column4: hello, how can i set up an existing printer for printing via wlan modem?
its a wlan device that connects with dsl for internet access. it's got an additional function, printing via wlan: I plug the printer into the wlan-modem. and should be able to print, but i'm Not ;-)
okay, well just to be clear here, it's just a dsl modem that allows computers to connect wirelessly to it?
ah okay, so if you plugged the printer in and if it has an IP, you should be able to set it up using the printing configuration tool
just make sure you tell it that you're looking for a network printer

i've done the following: (1) duplicated my existing printer in -> system -> printers. (2) changed settings: device-uri  -> change -> network-printer -> lpd/lpr-host (3) entered as host: socket://<IP-address> (4) sEARCH for printers/printer queues. it didn't work
I see, what's the make/model of the printer?
can you print if you connect the printer directly?
yes, that's working fine, printing directly.
so what's preventing you from adding the new printer instead of copying the currently working printer?
got it! i had to type in the ip address only without "socket://" in front of it. yeah!!! thanks for your support!!
have a good day from me too! : ) bye, everybody!
ps: you gave me the idea to try a network-printer-conection. for windows, its differently...
ah yes, that is true - glad you figured it out
